GeneralInformation.History: Created 2000 and acquired institutional accreditation in 2016 and programme accreditation in 2019.

Address.university_name: Academiat Addirasat Alulia – Academy of Postgraduate Studies (AGS)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1988 as Institute of Graduate Studies and Economic Sciences. Acquired present status and title 1994.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to February; February to June
AdmissionRequirements: First university degree with general average 'good'

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1988 as Jamaa't Assaaba Men April (Seventh of April University). Acquired present title and status 2011.

The university was established as Alasmarya University for Islamic Sciences in 1995 to teach The Holy Qur’an, Sharia and Linguistic Sciences, and History.
Acquired present name and status Alasmarya Islamic University “Al-Jāmi’a Alasmarya Al'islamiha” in 2013 to teach all types of sciences including religious, legitimate, human, social, economics, basic, applied, medical, and health.

It previously existed in 1506 as Zawiya of Alasmari to teach the Holy Qur’an and Sharia and Linguistic Sciences and went on to become Alasmari Institute between 1935 and 1986.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Ashahada Athanawiya); Student should be a Social Science Secondary school graduate (specialization: shari'a or General Secondary); Student must know by heart the Holy Quran

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as the Higher Institute of Industry,1989. Acquired present title 2010.
Founded 1984. Previously known as Seventh of October University. Acquired current status 2010 after merger with the University of Elmergib (created 1986 as Nasser University).
Part of Garyounis University until 1984. Founded 1985.
AdmissionRequirements: High school certificate with a certain minimum percentage

Divisions.Details: Also in Derna, Tobrak and Al-Quba

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1983, incorporating the Faculty of Education of the University of Al-Fateh
Founded 1955 as University of Libya, reorganized as two separate Universities in Benghazi and Tripoli, 1974. Became Garyounis University, 1976. Acquired present title 2011.
Founded 1989 as University of Qar Younes. Became Al-Tahadi University 1992

Founded 1957 as University of Libya, reorganized as two separate universities in Tripoli and Benghazi, 1973. Renamed Al Fateh University in 1976. Acquired former name of University of Tripoli in 2011.
